DOCNAME: CASE OF ALİ GÜNEŞ v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Helen Keller;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is a high school teacher , an executive member of ORG and a member of ORG .
CARDINAL . The DATE NATO summit took place in GPE from DATE . The Governor of GPE designated CARDINAL locations in GPE where people would be allowed to hold demonstrations .

CARDINAL . As the remaining facts of the case are in dispute between the parties , they will be set out separately . The facts as presented by the applicant are set out in Section B below ( paragraphs CARDINAL ) and the Government ’s submissions concerning the facts are summarised in Section C below ( paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) . The documentary evidence and further factual elements submitted by the applicant and the Government is summarised in Section D ( paragraphs DATE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and a number of other teachers arrived at the square outside FAC in GPE , which is CARDINAL of the CARDINAL locations referred to above , to issue a press release .

CARDINAL . The applicant and all his colleagues were unarmed and behaved in a peaceful manner . Nevertheless , police officers who had been circling the crowds grabbed the applicant and his friends by the arms , sprayed them with tear gas and beat them up .
CARDINAL . The police officers then took the applicant to a police station , where he was kept for a period of TIME . He was subsequently brought before a prosecutor , who ordered his release .

CARDINAL . After the applicant and other demonstrating teachers finished reading their press release , police officers asked them to disperse . When the demonstrators refused to do so , the police officers warned them that they would be taken into custody . The group continued to refuse to disperse and , instead , went on to stage a sit - in protest . They told the police officers that they would continue with their protest until their friends , who had been arrested elsewhere , had been released .

CARDINAL . When the police continued to try to persuade them , the demonstrators attacked the police with stones and sticks . They also damaged cars in the vicinity and injured a number of police officers . As a result , the police officers used tear gas in order to disperse them . The applicant was taken to the police station , where he was kept for a period of TIME before his release was ordered by a prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by CARDINAL doctors . The first examination was carried out at TIME at ORG . The doctor noted that the applicant ’s eyes were red , and considered it necessary for the applicant to be examined by a specialist doctor . The specialist doctor who examined the applicant at ORG at TIME on DATE noted that there was no sign on the applicant ’s body that he had been subjected to ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . According to a report prepared on DATE by CARDINAL of the police officers who had taken part in the incident , the spokesperson for the demonstrators in Mecidiyeköy told the police officers that a number of fellow union members had been arrested at another location in GPE earlier in DATE . The spokesperson added that the demonstrators in Mecidiyeköy would not be dispersing unless and until their friends had been released , and would instead march to FAC . When the police informed the spokesperson that this would not be allowed and warned the demonstrators to disperse , the demonstrators attacked the police officers with the sticks from their banners , and proceeded to stage a sit - in protest . ORG ( ORG ) then dispersed the demonstrators and arrested CARDINAL persons , including the applicant , who refused to disperse .

CARDINAL . The incident was widely reported in the national press . In a photograph published in the DATE newspaper GPE the applicant is pictured between CARDINAL police officers who are holding him by the arms , and one of whom is spraying the applicant ’s nose and mouth with gas at very close range .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor at ORG , who noted redness in both eyes and referred him to a specialist doctor . The ophthalmologist who examined the applicant DATE at the same hospital observed hyperaemia in both eyes , and recorded his findings in a report .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE the applicant was apparently examined by another doctor . However , no entries were made by that doctor in the sections of the report reserved for detailing the incident , the applicant ’s allegations and the doctor ’s findings . These parts of the report were simply crossed out by the doctor . Thus , the report only mentions the name of the applicant , his date of birth , the time of the medical examination and the name of the police officer who accompanied him .

CARDINAL . It appears that the applicant was examined by yet another doctor on DATE . The doctor noted in his report ( report no . CARDINAL ) that there were ecchymosed areas measuring QUANTITY and QUANTITY below the applicant ’s shoulders . The doctor also noted that the applicant ’s eyes were reddened .

CARDINAL . According to medical reports submitted by the Government , the CARDINAL demonstrators who had been arrested together with the applicant ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) also had various injuries on their bodies .

CARDINAL . The applicant and the other demonstrators were brought before the prosecutor and questioned . In his statement the applicant maintained that he had not committed any offences but had simply exercised his democratic rights . He also informed the prosecutor that the police had used pepper spray against him . According to the statement , a lawyer was present during the applicant ’s questioning .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an official complaint with the PERSON prosecutor against the police officers . He argued that when he and his colleagues had been preparing for their press release at TIME on DATE of the incident , a number of police officers had attacked them with their truncheons and sprayed them with tear gas . He complained that he had been beaten up with truncheons and punched and kicked by the police officers even after he had been arrested . He pointed out that the police officers responsible could be identified from the photographs published in the newspapers . The applicant argued that the police ORG actions had been in violation of both the domestic legislation and his rights under the LAW , including his rights to liberty and security , freedom of expression and protection from ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . The applicant subsequently found out in DATE that before he had even lodged his official complaint on DATE a prosecutor had already decided on DATE not to prosecute the police officers . In the prosecutor ’s decision QUANTITY persons , including the applicant , were referred to as “ the complainants ” . The QUANTITY persons also included the QUANTITY demonstrators arrested together with the applicant ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . The QUANTITY police officers ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) were named as the defendants . The offence in question was given as “ ill - treatment ” .

CARDINAL . The prosecutor stated in his decision that the police officers had allowed the demonstrators to read out their press release but that when the demonstrators had wanted to march to GPE square , they had had to disperse them . In the opinion of the prosecutor the officers had been carrying out their duties under the LAW on the Powers and Duties of the Police , and had not committed any offences . Despite the fact that it was expressly stated in the decision that it was to be communicated to the complainants , and that the complainants could lodge objections against it , the prosecutor ’s decision was not communicated to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the PERSON prosecutor and asked for information about the investigation .
CARDINAL . In his reply of CARDINAL DATE the PERSON prosecutor forwarded to the applicant ’s legal representative a copy of the decision adopted by his office on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an objection against the decision and drew attention to the prosecutor ’s failure to have regard to the medical reports described above ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL above ) and the photographs of him in the press .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the objection , stating that the prosecutor ’s decision of DATE had been in compliance with the applicable legislation and procedure .
